Harris (D) November 3, 2020 November 5, 2024 U.S. Senator Alex Padilla (D) November 8, 2022 March 7, 2028 U.S. Senator Laphonza Butler (D) October 1, 2023** November 5, 2024 U.S. Representative 11th District Nancy Pelosi (D) November 8, 2022 November 5, 2024 U.S. Representative 15th District Kevin Mullin (D) November 8, 2022 November 5, 2024 D=Democrat; R=Republican *The Vice President is indirectly elected together with the President to a four-year term by the people of the United States through the Electoral College **Appointed by the Governor to fill a vacant seat ***Appointed by the Mayor to fill a vacant seat Back to top Term limits Local office term limits The following offices have 4-year terms, with no term limit: Assessor-Recorder, City Attorney, District Attorney, Public Defender, Sheriff, Treasurer, Members of the Board of Education, Members of the Community College Board The following offices have 4-year terms, and office holders may not serve for more than 2 successive terms: Mayor, Members of the Board of Supervisors State office term limits The following offices have 4-year terms, and office holders may not serve for more than 2 terms: Governor, Lieutenant Governor, Secretary of State, Controller, Treasurer, Attorney General, Insurance Commissioner, Superintendent of Public Instruction, and members of the Board of Equalization The following offices have 4-year terms and 2-year terms*, respectively: State Senate and State Assembly * Members of the California Legislature may not serve for more than 12 years in total. Service in either chamber counts toward this limit. Federal office term limits The following offices have 4-year terms, and office holders may not serve for more than 2 terms: President & Vice President The following office has 2-year terms, with no term limit: U.S. Representative The following office has 6-year terms, with no term limit: U.S. Senator Back to top Departments Department of Elections You must have JavaScript enabled to use this form.
